oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Treaty of the Hickory Ground
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Andrew Jackson at the Treaty of the Hickory Ground. Three Native Americans sitting on ground and one standing with arm raised. Two sitting soldiers, writing at a table, with five more soldiers standing around them. Three of the soldiers are officers. "Treaty of the Hickory Ground"
Also known as the Treaty of Fort Jackson which ended the Creek War in August 1814. The location is at the confluence of the Coosa and Tallapoosa Rivers in Alabama.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845
